headline: Feta-Spinach Puff Pastry Bites
description: These puff pastry bites filled with feta, spinach, and Parmesan cheese are the perfect baked small appetizer when entertaining.
name: Feta-Spinach Puff Pastry Bites
recipeIngredient: 1 sheet frozen puff pastry, thawed in the refrigerator
1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (180 degrees C). Spray cups of a 24-cup mini muffin pan (or 2 12-cup mini muffin pans) with nonstick cooking spray.

Roll out the thawed but cold puff pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface into a rectangle using a rolling pin. Cut into 24 (approximately 2 1/2-inch) squares using a pizza cutter. Lightly press puff pastry squares into each cup of the prepared mini muffin pan and prick with the tines of a fork.
Mix the mayonnaise, feta cheese, Parmesan cheese, spinach, garlic, and pepper together in a bowl.
Spoon feta-spinach mixture evenly into the cups, being careful not to overflow the cups.
Bake in the preheated oven until pastry is puffed and the corners are golden brown, 15 to 16 minutes.
Cool in the pan on a wire rack for 5 minutes before transferring the bites to a serving dish.

review.reviewBody: These are wonderful! First thing to go at the Christmas Party! I made them in a tart pan, came out great! Will definitely make again!

I used this recipe for a holiday get together. Always nervous to try a new dish with a group but this one was a hit! I used low fat mayo & feta and added chopped pecans. My mini muffin silicone baking dish only holds 20 mini muffins so they had extra stuffing. It took 18 minutes to bake to a good crust. I let them cool briefly on a wire rack before packing to go to the party. I will definitely make them to share agsin!

I love spinach and this recipe looked like a great one to make for an upcoming party calling for us to bring "finger food" appetizers. I made a lower calorie version using lite mayo, and fat free feta. It was a fabulous combination of ingredients inside a puff pastry - one party in my mouth! I believe next time I may add some chopped pecans. It did take the full 16 minutes to bake. Simple, easy and tasty! And, makes a great presentation. Highly recommend this recipe!
